dmca.title: [AB-C22483B] ISP Letter sent: Compumusic.com/Sony Camcorder

From: abuse@theplanet.com [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com]

Thank you,

The Planet Internet Services, Inc. 
http://www.theplanet.com/legal/

From: "Jill Badlotto" <jill@netenforcers.com>

Received-SPF: none (mx01.filter.theplanet.com: 69.25.50.217 is neither permitted nor
denied by domain of netenforcers.com) client-ip=69.25.50.217;
envelope-from=jill@netenforcers.com; helo=ms17.mse9.exchange.ms; 

 (multipart/related)
Multipart prefix (text/plain)
This is a multi-part message in MIME format. 
 
 (multipart/alternative)
MIME element (text/plain)
The below is a Cease and Desist letter referencing your client Compumusic.com and
our client Sony with specific respects to Camcorder. Your client continues the use
the copyrighted images/text and/or trademarked logos of Sony Camcorder. The notice
was originally sent to your client on 06/09/06. As of this time the website was
rechecked and the infringing material has not been removed in its entirety. We are
informing you in an attempt to get this resolved. Please assist us in having this
material removed from your clients' website.  
________________________________ 
 
Phoenix Office: 
 
 
Ellis & Venable 
 
 
101 N. First Avenue, Suite 1875 
 
 
Phoenix, Arizona 85003 
 
voice: (602) 631-9393 
 
fax: (602) 631-9796 
 
  
 
6/22/2006 
 
  
 
  
 
 
7005 3110 0000 6653 8357 
 
 
  
 
VIA CERTIFIED US MAIL 
 
RETURN RECEIPT REQUESTED 
 
  
 
ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc. 
 
George Poletes 
 
1333 Stemmons Pwy., Ste. 110, 
 
Dallas,TX.75207 
 
  
 
Re:       Unauthorized Use of Sony'S Trademarks and/or Copyrighted Materials 
 
  
 
Dear Designated Agent: 
 
  
 
We have been retained by our client, Net Enforcers, Inc., to contact you with
respect to unauthorized use of Sony's trademarks and/or copyrighted materials.   
 
  
 
Sony has retained Net Enforcers to assist with the protection and enforcement of its
rights in Sony-owned or licensed trademarks, logos, and other copyrighted materials.
 Net Enforcers has in turn retained us to assist with this matter.  Pursuant to 17
U.S.C. § 512 (c)(3)(A) and 15 U.S.C. § 1125(a) and 1114 et seq, we hereby notify
you of Sony's good faith belief that your client, compumusic.com, at the URL
www.compumusic.com, is using Sony trademarks and/or copyrighted materials without
authorization by Sony, its agents, or the law, specifically with respect to
camcorder products sold by Sony's Personal Mobile Imaging Division. Sony has a good
faith belief that the information contained in this letter is accurate, and under
penalty of perjury, Net Enforcers is authorized to act on behalf of Sony. 
 
  
 
            The specific works, graphics or other material Sony believes to be
infringed or to be the subject of infringing activity (the "Infringing
Material") are copyrighted images from Sony's website.  Specific
violations of copyrighted images by compumusic.com are listed below this
paragraph. 
 
  
 
http://compumusic.com/i1265.htm 
 
http://compumusic.com/i38528.htm 
 
  
 
            Therefore, pursuant to the requirements of 17 U.S.C. § 512(c)(1)(C),
Sony hereby demands that you remove or disable access to the Infringing
Material in an expeditious manner.   
 
  
 
  
 
If you have questions, please contact Net Enforcers Compliance Management Department
via facsimile to 501-646-6242, or via email to
Compliance.Management@NetEnforcers.com.  All communications should be in writing. 
However, if you wish to speak with Net Enforcers directly, you may contact them at
501-646-6242.  Sony has authorized Net Enforcers to handle and resolve this matter
with you.  Please do not contact Sony directly, as Sony will simply refer the matter
back to Net Enforcers.  If your designated agent or representation does not respond
to this demand as requested by 5:00 p.m. on 7/4/2006, we will assume that this
demand has been rejected and proceed accordingly. 
 
Sincerely, 
 
Ellis & Venable 
 
  
 
Lance C. Venable 
 
Attorney at Law 
 
  
 
LCV/roc
